Pre-Game Insights: The New York Mets and Milwaukee Brewers are set to face off in an unlikely NL Wild Card Series beginning Tuesday in Milwaukee.
The Mets finished playing a series in Milwaukee on Sunday before heading to Atlanta to play a makeup doubleheader Monday that determined the NL's final two playoff participants.
The Mets went 75-87 in 2023 and were 22-33 near the end of May, but they came on strong the rest of the way under new manager Carlos Mendoza to earn the NL's final wild-card spot.
Milwaukee won its second straight NL Central title despite losing key players and their manager.
The Brewers have won 12 of their last 14 meetings with the Mets and were 5-0 against the Mets this year before losing 5-0 on Sunday.
Much of Milwaukee's success against the Mets has come from its running game, stealing 17 bases in six games against New York without getting caught.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Brewers installed new padding to the section of wall that Sal Frelick hit after he bruised his left hip while chasing a foul ball.
Milwaukee’s Brice Turang went 9 of 19 and stole seven bases without getting caught in the Brewers’ six regular-season games with the Mets.
New York’s Francisco Alvarez went 7 for 15 with a homer, four RBIs and a 1.260 OPS against the Brewers this season.
Others: Freddy Peralta will start Game 1 for the Brewers, but the pitching setup beyond that is not disclosed.
The Mets figure to start Luis Severino and Sean Manaea in the first two games, with Jose Quintana available for a potential Game 3.
Milwaukee outfielder Sal Frelick bruised his left hip but stated he will be ready to play.
